Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pentatomicin (antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, 3S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature.Author: Nishide Y, Nagamine K, Kageyama D, Moriyama M, Futahashi R, Fukatsu T. 2022
Literature.Title: A new antimicrobial peptide, Pentatomicin, from the stinkbug Plautia stali

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (32.11%) tortCATH_1GRAVY: -0.828; Mol Wt: 11521.707; mol formula: C488H758N146O157S7; mol ex Coeff: 18925.Activity: active against Gram-positive bacteria:  B.subtilis (MIC 100–1000 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 1–10 ug/ml), and S. aureus (MIC 10–100 µg/ml), but not against Gram-negative bacteria (E.coli,  E.cloacae, Pantoea sp., the gut symbiont of P.stal, MIC >1000 ug/ml i) and Gram+ (E. faecalis and E.faecium, MIC >1000 ug/ml).
